intro: Eschscholzia crocea var. rosea, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright orange to red petals and yellow stamens, which give it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and has a low, spreading habit. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its stem is branched and covered in fine hairs. The California poppy is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
